channel.title: 2023s on The California Tech
channel.description: Recent content in 2023s on The California Tech

item.title: The California Tech April 11, 2023 Print Issue
item.description: Read the articles online, or click here to view the print version.

item.title: Student Faculty Conference Next Week on 4/18
item.description: For the first time in four years, the 2023 Student Faculty Conference will be held in-person on April 18th in Ramo Auditorium. The Student Faculty Conference (SFC) is an all-day forum discussion between students and faculty.

item.title: Caltech Theater & MACH 33 Presents: The Sunrise From The Moon
item.description: “Space, Love, Loss, Jellyfish, and lots of Vanilla Coke.” Tickets available here

item.title: ASCIT Board of Directors Meeting Minutes for April 9, 2023
Caltech Y 2023 Spring Break Trip to Hawai’i
item.description: After a 3 year hiatus due to COVID, the Caltech Y hosted their 7-day Alternative Spring Break (ASB) trip to the Hawaiian islands. Attendees included graduate and undergraduate students alike, all with varying backgrounds, countries of origin, and courses of study.

item.title: Gerard for Unilateral Excomm
item.description: Well folks, let me tell you something just awful and terrible that the stupid FRICKS at Ricketts Hovse have been hiding. Gerard Decker (’26, Ricketts), a fantastic guy, a really great guy, was robbed, yes robbed, of becoming the Unilateral Excomm of Ricketts Hovse.

item.title: Imaging The Beginning Of Time From The South Pole
item.description: My research work at Caltech is trying to precisely address the most fundamental questions that have ever been posed by a human being: “How did the universe begin?”

item.title: Puzzles and Funnies (Week of April 11, 2023)
item.description: Now with interactive crossword puzzles! Also: submit your Questions for the Quail!

item.title: Rolling is Real Winner in Dabney vs. Fleming Discobolus
item.description: March 13, 2023, 8PM | The scene is set: it’s a mild night with a soft breeze. The runners take their marks around the track. 3, 2, 1, and they’re off!

item.title: Spotlight: Sean Cutting, Accessibility Services Specialist
item.description: According to a recent estimate, more than 250 students at Caltech receive some form of disability accommodation – academic, housing, dietary, or otherwise.

item.title: Springtime Comes to Campus - Photography Feature
item.description: Springtime is here, and the Tech is back on campus. The Tech’s photography team has been out and about, capturing the beauty of the season on campus.

item.title: The South Hovse Hot Water Saga: Chili Today, Cold Tamale
item.description: Many South Hovse denizens over the past few months have gone to shower only to be disappointed by lukewarm or cold water temperatures. This is their story.

item.title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie: A Light in the Darkness
item.description: I’ll make no bones about it. The Super Mario Bros. Movie was easily the most anticipated movie of the year, if not the last decade.

item.title: This Week in the Houses...
ASCIT Winter Election Results
April Art Spotlight
ɐᴉlɐɹʇsnⱯ ɟO ɔᴉƃɐꟽ ǝɥꓕ
item.description: ˙ᴉdʎʇɐld ƃuᴉpnlɔuᴉ ‘ǝɟᴉlplᴉʍ ǝsɹǝʌᴉp ʎllɐuoᴉʇdǝɔxǝ sʇᴉ ɹo ɟ uʍouʞ-llǝʍ sᴉ ‘ǝɹǝɥdsᴉɯǝɥ uɹǝɥʇnos ǝɥʇ uᴉ ʎɹʇunoɔ ƃuᴉʞɐǝds-ɥsᴉlƃuƎ uɐ ‘ɐᴉlɐɹʇsn∀

item.title: Banana 99
item.description: Ah, bananas, the fruit that comes in its own convenient packaging. It’s nature’s way of saying, ‘Here, have a snack on the go.’ But have you ever stopped to think about the humble banana and all the things it can do?

item.title: Dabney Lies at a Dangerous Crossroads
item.description: What do you do when the cure is worse than the disease?

item.title: Fizz Asserts Control
item.description: Since the very first day I stepped foot on campus for winter term, I knew Fizz was going to be nothing but trouble. No worthwhile product has ever been advertised with colorful cardstock flyers delivered to doorsteps.

item.title: Gift Shops
item.description: I love the little shops they have in museums and places. They’re the best thing in the whole world. Every time I go into a new place I look and see if there are any little shops.

item.title: Investigation into Crimes Against the California Tech
item.description: I aim to keep the general public informed about this dangerous individual as well as garner information which will help lead to his capture.

item.title: The Critter Corner
item.description: The Caltech undergraduate population has, despite its small size, a diverse variety of species that make up the techer population. This week we’ll embark on an in-depth analysis of a peculiar invasive species of Techer that has emerged in the Caltech ecosystem: the iPad Kid.

item.title: THE HOT RIVET April 4, 2023 (April Fool's Issue)
item.description: Read the articles online, or click here to view the print version.

item.title: THE HOT RIVET Puzzles Section
The Yam Controversy
item.description: November 2021 – I was but a young naïve frosh, getting my dinner from open kitchen. I sighted orange disks of vegetables and was full of hope, sweet potatoes iare some of my favorite foods. However, my hope quickly turned to confusion when the person in front of me ordered “yams”.

item.title: Transcript of Admissions Tour Leaked
item.description: Are you a REAL CALTECH STUDENT if you have never attended one of the Undergraduate Admission Office’s HOT, FACTUALLY-CORRECT, and VERY FUN tours lead by the current generation of Caltech students???

item.title: Un Lettre de Rupture
item.description: Je ne peux pas continuer comme ça. J’ai essayé très fort de faire cette relation travailler entre nous, mais ce n’est plus possible. J’espère que tu le vois aussi. Si tu ne comprends pas, permets-moi de l’explique.

item.title: What To Do During Your Power Hum
item.description: #8 will SHOCK you!

item.title: Who Will Sonic End Up With in the Next Movie?
item.description: In the leadup to the third feature film in the Sonic the Hedgehog cinematic universe, the Sonic fandom eagerly awaits the answer to one of gaming’s most prominent questions: who will be Sonic’s relationship partner?

item.title: A Chat with Meri Makhmuryan
item.description: In November 2022, the Caltech Center for Inclusion and Diversity (CCID) welcomed a new Program Coordinator, Meri Makhmuryan, to join the staff.

item.title: Making the Case for the Orange Crewmate
item.description: 2022’s Frosh Camp Counselors attempted rallied in support of getting all incoming frosh orange crewmate plushies from the video game Among Us.

item.title: Fizz: Coming to a Campus Near You
item.description: On the first day of winter term, on-campus students woke up to find small glossy flyers outside their doors, advertising an app called “Fizz”…

item.title: Growing Student Body Leads to Undergraduate Housing Shortage
item.description: For almost as long as Caltech had undergraduate students, the institute has guaranteed its students housing on campus for four years. Almost.

item.title: I Haven't Been Paid for My Work in Three Years. What's Up With That?
item.description: It was a simpler time three years ago.

item.title: Interview with Hima Vatti About the Caltech Title IX Program
item.description: Interview with Hima Vatti, Caltech’s Title IX Coordinator and Director of the Equity and Title IX Office.

item.title: March Art Spotlight
Question the Quail! #1
item.description: A new advice column about life, love, classes, and everything in between! Brought to you by the one and only California Tech.

item.title: Reinstate, It Cannot Wait: A collective call to action for an international scholar
item.description: Last Friday, on the 24th of February, a group of about 40 Caltech graduate students and postdoctoral researchers delivered a petition signed by over 400 of our colleagues, in support of an international graduate student.

item.title: The California Tech March 3, 2023 Print Issue
item.description: Read the articles online, or click here to view the print version.

item.title: The CRC is Back
item.description: It’s no exaggeration to say life as we know it would not be possible without the Honor Code. We often take this implicit trust between students, faculty, and staff, for granted. But as in any relationship, this trust can start to degrade over time if it is not reassessed and reaffirmed.

item.title: Tom Mannion's Recipes
item.description: Tom Mannion is the Senior Director of Student Activities and Programs at the Office of Residential Experience and the instructor of Caltech’s cooking class. These are two recipes from his collection!

item.title: Winter Term Interhouse Spotlight
